info.name: Connect
info.description:
# Overview
This collection holds API calls used for Aya Connect

# Authentication
You should first use the POST token method before making any other calls; this will save the bearer token that is used to authenticate other API calls in Connect

item.name: Job Approvals

exec: pm.test("Response time is less than 2000ms", function() {

request.description:
## Should return 403 error if:
> User does not have jobapprovalprocess.view permission 
----
## Returns:
> List of facility and unit processes, based on approval processes created for facilities and units the user is a member of

response.name: 200 OK Response With Processes

exec: pm.test("Response time is less than 2000ms", function() {

request.description:
## Should return 403 error if:
> User does not have jobapprovalprocess.view permission 
----
## Returns:
> List of facility and unit processes, based on approval processes created for facilities and units the user is a member of

response.name: 200 OK Response With Processes

exec: pm.test("Response time is less than 2000ms", function() {

query.description: Optional parameter that indicates the processId to check eligible units for

request.description:
##	Should return error if:
*		User does not have jobapprovalprocess.edit permission
 *			Should return 403 error code
----
##	Returns
*		List of units, grouped by facility profile group, that can be added to a facility process by a user
 *			Should not include units that are part of facilites that DO NOT have job approvals enabled
*		Each unit has an hasExistingProcess property. This indicates if the facility profile group is already part of another process. 
 *			If you make this call with a processId parameter, hasExistingProcess will be false if the unit is a member of the process, and should equal true if the processId parameter is not included or is a member of a different process
----
## Usage
* Used when getting units that can be added to a unit approval process

response.name: 200 OK Response with Units

query.description: Optional parameter that indicates the processId to check eligible units for

response.name: Get Eligible Units For Existing Process

exec: pm.test("Response time is less than 2000ms", function() {

query.description: optional parameter that indicates the processId

request.description:
##	Should return error if:
*	User does not have jobapprovalprocess.edit permission
 *	Should return 403 error code
----
##	Returns
*	List of facility profile groups that can be added to a facility process by a user
 *	Each facilityProfileGroup has an hasExistingProcess property. This indicates if the facility profile group is already part of another process. 
  *	If you make this call with a processId parameter, hasExistingProcess will be false if the facility profile group is a member of the process, and should equal true if the processId parameter is not included or is a member of a different process
----

response.name: 200 OK Response With Units

query.description: optional parameter that indicates the processId

request.description:
##	Should return error if:
*	User does not have jobapprovalprocess.edit permission (see New Permissions For Job Approvals testing section above for instructions on how to set)
*	If type: 2 (tierBased)
 *		Process does not include tiers or tiers: [],
 *		Process tiers are not in sequential order (based on tierNumber property for each tier)
 *		One or more tier does not include any tierApproverIds or tierApproverIds: []
 *		The process includes facilityIds or unitIds that the user is not a member of
 *		The process includes facilityIds or unitIds that are already part of another process
----
##	After successful call, should be able to see added process as part of body returned in GET Processes

request.description:
##	Description

- 
This is the endpoint we are using to test job approvals with jobs that have job approval processes
----

##	Expected Result
----

- Will return jobs approved at job level, jobs approved at tier level (with ids of approvers for next tier), and jobs approved at user level

response.name: Approve Jobs With Process Example Request and Response

request.description:
##	Description

- 
This is the endpoint we are using to test job rejections with jobs that have job approval processes
----

##	Expected Result
----

- Will return number of jobs where status was updated

response.name: Reject Jobs With Process Example Request and Response

request.description:
##	Should return error if:
*	User does not have jobapprovalprocess.edit permission (see New Permissions For Job Approvals testing section above for instructions on how to set)
*	If type: 2 (tierBased)
 *		Process does not include tiers or tiers: [],
 *		Process tiers are not in sequential order (based on tierNumber property for each tier)
 *		One or more tier does not include any tierApproverIds or tierApproverIds: []
 *		The process includes facilityIds or unitIds that the user is not a member of
 *		The process includes facilityIds or unitIds that are already part of another process
----
##	After successful call, should be able to see process with updated properties returned as part of body returned in GET Processes

response.name: Edit Processes Multiple Tiers, Approvers, Units

request.description:
##	Should return error if:
*		User does not have jobapprovalprocess.edit permission 
 *		Should return 403 code
*		No process exists for the process id passed in
*		The process includes facilities or units that the user is not a member of
*		The process is a facility process (level: 2)
----
##	After successful call, should no longer see process as part of body returned in GET Processes

query.description: (Optional) facility profile group ids to check

request.description:
# Gets approvers that can be added to a process

## Should return error if:
*		User does not have jobapprovalprocess.edit permission
 *		Should return 403 error code
----
##	Returns
*		List of users that have job approval permissions for the facility ids/unit ids passed in the parameters
----
## Usage
* Used when getting users that can be added as approvers to a job approval process

response.name: 200 OK Response With Approvers For Units
200 OK Eligible Approvers For Facility Profile Groups

query.description: (Optional) facility profile group ids to check

    "jobTitle": "Will L Process Test Unit Process 11-15 #4",

    "startDate": "2019-10-18T07:00:00.000Z",
    "description": "*Aya Interview\n# of Needs: 1\nStart Date: 4/9 \nDuration: 13 weeks\nShift: 3-12 hour Nights includes working weekends when needed\n\n4SE Short Stay is a procedural and surgical short stay unit with some medicine overflow.  Typical patients are post cardiac cath, EP, Interventional Radiology, Surgical (gyn, urology, general surgery.  \n\nPatients typically stay 24 hours then discharge home.  RNs pull sheaths on cardiac patients.  We do not expect travelers have this skill.  However, strong cardiac tele required.",

    "releaseSchedulingEnabled": true
  }
}

request.description:
## Steps To Test
* Update the hospitalId and unitId properties based on the unit you are looking to save a job for

>Make sure that the unit id and facility id matchup, ie. the unit id you are saving for falls under the facility you are saving for, and that the user you are logged in as is a member of that facility

>If you are saving an existing job, update the id property with the Job Id you are saving for, otherwise the id property should be set to 0

>If you want to help differentiate the jobs you’re saving, you can update the jobTitle property

* Click **Send**

>If the job was routed to a process with no approvals, the error will start with Failed to send job added notification

>If the job was routed to a process that’s tier based, the error will start with "Job Pending Email Notifications disabled for specified facility."

>If you saved an existing job, the error will probably start with "Job Edited Email Notifications disabled for specified facility."

>**Please use the examples saved for the Postman request as a guide, they show what I’m talking about above**

* To see the new ids of the saved jobs, log into Connect as the same user and go to the Jobs grid. Look for the title that matches up with the jobTitle you saved for your job

* If tier based, the job should now have an approval process applied to it, and you can use the Approve/Reject Jobs With Process endpoints in Postman to test approval actions

response.name: Save New Job With Process - Type No Approval Process

item.name: Enable or Disable Job Approvals For Facility

request.description: Use to enable or disable job approvals for a facility by updating the facilityId and isEnabled properties

item.description:
These are endpoints related to the Job Approvals Process project.


>The tech design for this project can be found [here](https://ayadev.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/PROJ/pages/818544693/Tech+Design+-+Approval+Processes)
